meanings.definition: Resembling a wire in appearance or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The thin, wirelike branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The new antenna had a wirelike design that improved signal reception.
meanings.sent3: The wirelike strands of spaghetti were so long, they could be used as jump ropes!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as wirelike as the strongest metal, never bending or breaking.
meanings.sent5: The wirelike fence surrounding the garden kept out all unwanted visitors.
